conclusion: Identify initial conditions and forces involved: masses m_A, m_B, m_C are all m; initial velocity of block C is v_0; distance traveled by block C before collision is s_0; spring constant is k; coefficient of kinetic friction is Î¼; gravitational acceleration is g.
Determine the speed of block C just before collision (v1) using work-energy theorem and accounting for work done by friction.
Calculate the speed of blocks B and C after collision (v2) using conservation of momentum.
Calculate the mechanical energy loss during the collision using initial and final kinetic energies.
